stories.text:
I'm hoping there's a standardized format/schema out there for "cataloging all the assets" that make up a software system. I.e, from Storage drives to container images, etc. would all have a centralized db entry with a unique UUID, and perhaps other attributes.

Purpose is for risk management, I'm sure this is a tractable (read: solved) problem; but my research skills are failing me this morning.

I'm picturing something like an ARN but across a company. We can leverage terraform meta to tag things consistently
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you approach tagging assets to catalog software system deps?

stories.text:
You've built an infrastructure on cloud (AWS, Azure, etc.).

It's the end of the month and you get the bill. It's not too bad, but it's more than what you expected. The next months, the bill stays as high or even grows bigger and bigger!

Now imaging there is a platform that gives you full visibility over your cloud costs in the simplest form with various high-level and low-level categorisations. A platform that offers you actionable AI-powered recommendations to reduce your cloud costs significantly.

We're building that platform. It's called CloudReclaim (https://cloudreclaim.com).

Stop sponsoring billionaires with over-paying for your cloud infrastructure! You can fill in this form to join our waiting list:

https://ur56nb612bb.typeform.com/to/pRnvwzPe
